did.unittitle:
Marion Celestia Siney papers
1929-1941
did.abstract: Student in history at the University of Michigan, also teaching assistant in the department of history. Class notes, examinations, research papers, reading notes, and lecture notes.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was the gift of Marion Celestia Siney (donor no. 6819).

accruals.p: No further additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open to research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: [item], folder, box, Marion Celestia Siney papers, 1931-1941, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Marion C. Siney was born August 11, 1913 in Muskegon, Michigan. She attended Muskegon Junior College in 1929 then transferred to the University of Michigan in 1931 where she received her bachelor's (1933), master's (1934) and doctorate in history (1938). She held a post-doctoral fellowship during 1938-1939 and then became a teaching fellow. In 1941, she received appointment as an in instructor at Western Reserve University.

scopecontent.p: The Siney collection consists of class notes, examinations, research papers, reading notes, and lecture notes from history and political sciences courses taken at the University of Michigan, 1931 to 1941.
